Suffolk Libraries

Emoji Book Quiz

Jan 20, 2016 • Matt Shenton

Can you guess the title of the book from the emoji symbols shown above? What could a question mark, a train, another train and a dragon signify?

The humble emoji was named as the Oxford Dictionaries word of the year for 2015, which is quite an achievement for a pictograph.

Inspired by the Christmas Emoji Book Quiz created by the Bookseller in December, I decided to have a go at creating a set of emoji book titles specifically for children’s literature. Not only are they fun (and at times infuriating!) but they introduce quality books and authors to those who take part.

There are two resources:

  • A short 15 question Emoji Quiz sheet that could be used as a starter or in a library quiz, or at an all staff CPD/INSET session to test staff knowledge on children’s literature! Answers are on a separate sheet.
  • A longer PowerPoint presentation that could be put on a loop in reception areas and libraries, or chopped up and used as a starter activity.

Pupils could then try to create their own representations of book titles by downloading the emoji symbols.

Have fun and let us know how you got on in the comments section!

</figure>
